converse.line: Good afternoon.

random.line: Leave me be. I don't want to talk to anyone right now...
Please leave, I wish to be alone.
(Fine, I didn't want to be here anyways.) Goodbye.

converse.line: Good afternoon.
What do you want, child? I wish to be alone.

choice.line: I heard you make some great candy.
You heard wrong, I make no such thing.
You bother me. Leave.
Is anything troubling you?
No!
Are you suuuuure?
...It doesn't concern you. A youngster like you wouldn't be interested in an old lady's troubles.
Talk it out with me. I want to help you.
...If you insist.
My husband died suddenly last week...

It was a sudden and tragic death. He was on his way to get a locket fixed for me when a thug murdered him. I couldn't believe it when I heard it. It...made me very sad. The locket was a gift he gave me on our honeymoon. It was a great piece, made of silver and gold. It used to give me great joy when I looked at it, but now the thought of it only brings great pain. The thug only murdered my husband when he wouldn't give up the locket.
I feel like it's my fault he died. If only I hadn't asked him to fix that locket...
People such as yourself have been nosy in trying to get me to feel better. But you don't understand that there is hardly anything that will calm my aching heart.
...Any who, thank you for listening to my story.
I am so sorry.
You are right.
Kids these days... Be gone! Out! Get!
Which way to the inn?
It's right next door. Are you mocking me? Out with you!

converse.line: You say there is nothing that will make you feel better?
Hardly anything, child. The only possession I had worth keeping was that locket. I will never forgive that dirty thief. Scum of the earth, he is.
(What could the thief have done with it?)
I found your locket, Nakamura.
Give it here, child.

No doubt about it, this is the locket... *Sniffle* You don't know what relief this brings me. Truly, you are a saint. I thank you from the bottom of my heart. It must have been hard work. I've got to repay you for your kindness. Is there anything you would like?

choice.line: You don't have to give me anything. I like helping people.
I can't have that. I must give you something in return. I know! Kids these days sure love their candy. How about I give you some? I used to be a confectioner back in my day.
That would be lovely. Thank you!
I heard that you make candy. Could I have some?
You heard correctly. I was a confectioner back in my day. I think I have some left over.
Sweet! Thanks, Nakamura!

converse.line: It's all thanks to mayor Rais. Do you recall his name?
Rais? Why, of course, child! He was a great friend back in the day. I can't believe I lost touch with him. Where is he?
He's mayor of Mourilyan. He would love to see you again.
I'll definately visit him. We have a lot of catching up to do.
Enjoy the candy, child.
Thanks!
Hey, Nacks!
Bless you.
I didn't sneeze! It's my new nickname for you, "Nacks."
Child, please don't ever call me that again.
You're no fun. See you later, Nacks!
Children these days. Have some respect for your elders!
